title: As 2025 ends, a failed AI prediction: 'LLM hallucinations...'
description: Reddit discussion reflecting on failed AI predictions at the end of 2025. The community notes how 'completely resigned to the fact that hallucinations are inherent to LLMs' they have become, contrary to earlier predictions that this problem would be solved by 2025. Discusses the implications of accepting hallucinations as a fundamental limitation of current LLM architectures and what this means for AI reliability in production systems.
author: Reddit Community (r/BetterOffline)

title: A guide to local coding models
description: Hacker News discussion about local coding models for development. The community explores options for running LLMs locally for coding tasks, with one commenter stating 'If you aren't using coding models you aren't ahead of the curve. There are free coding...' Discussion covers privacy benefits, offline capabilities, and specific model recommendations for developers who want to run AI coding tools locally rather than relying on cloud APIs.
author: Hacker News Community

title: December 2025 Guide To Popular AI Coding Agents
description: Comprehensive Reddit guide to AI coding agents as of December 2025. The post notes 'there are now so many options it's hard to keep track of them all' and provides an overview of various AI coding agents and their capabilities. Covers Claude Code, Cursor, and other emerging tools, comparing their features, use cases, and effectiveness for different development workflows.
author: Reddit Community (r/codingagent)
